result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle R. Bunck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall pay restitution directly to Clerk of Courts. 
Defendant shall have restitution paid by March of 2023.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall not have any contact with the C.O.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michelle R. Bunck in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Michelle R. Bunck.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1. State will recommend 2 years probation with the following conditions: counseling DOC deems appropriate, no contact with C.O., pay restitution within the first 6 months for $100, maintain absolute sobriety, serve 14 days in jail, submit a DNA sample, and to pay court cots. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, counseling, programming, and treatment that DOC deems appropriate, to have no contact with C.O., to pay restitution of $100 by March of 2023, not to possess or consume any alcohol, not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, to pay court costs, and to provide a DNA sample.
for Confidential Victim Impact Statement- Denied

Defendant Michelle R. Bunck appeared by phone.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Michelle R. Bunck.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Jaden McCullick sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: received. Cross. Attorney Bartelt waives argument and objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause to bind matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.

Defendant Michelle R. Bunck in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests a signature bond with a condition not to have any contact with Victim#1 and not to possess or consume any alcohol. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with conditions not to have any contact with Victim #1 and not to possess or consume any alcohol. Status date set.

Defendant shall have no contact with Victim 1. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol during the pendency of this case.
